title: Social Media and Content Creator Job at Home Bargains Nigeria Limited
content:
Home Bargains Nigeria Limited is a gift and decor store situated in Abuja, Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media and Content Creator

Job Location: Wuse Zone 1, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time
Working Schedule: Four times a week

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	In this role, you will create engaging content to showcase our unique gift products and enhance our brand presence.
	You'll be responsible for producing content for social media and promotional materials that connect with customers.
	If you’re passionate about gifts and content creation, we’d love to have you on board!


Responsibilities


	Create engaging video content for social media platforms (Instagram, TikTok, Facebook, etc.) that showcases products, store promotions, and seasonal offerings.
	Produce high-quality product videos, including unboxings, demonstrations, tutorials, and customer testimonials, to highlight the unique features of gift items.
	Design promotional videos and ads to support sales campaigns, new arrivals, and special events, ensuring videos are aligned with the brand’s aesthetic and goals.
	Collaborate with the marketing team to develop content strategies that increase online visibility and drive traffic to the store.
	Edit and optimize videos for each platform, ensuring content is tailored to platform-specific formats and engagement trends.
	Create attention-grabbing video content that showcases store events, product launches, or exclusive offers to entice customers.
	Design eye-catching promotional materials(such as banners, flyers, and social media posts) to support video content and store promotions.
	Monitor performance of video content across platforms, analysing metrics to improve future content and drive higher sales conversions.
	Keep up with trends in video marketing and social media to continuously evolve content and stay relevant to the target audience
	More tasks as may be required.


Requirements


	Minimum of an HND qualification
	3 years of experience.


Salary
N100,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover letter to: ad.homebargains@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Content Creator Job at Tilden Development Limited
content:
Tilden Development Limited is a development company that specializes in innovative residential hospitality and commercial developments in Lagos. Our aim is to harness investments in the real estate sector and provide our investors with transparency, quality customer satisfaction, and timely service delivery.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Content Creator

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a creative and dynamic Content Creator to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for producing engaging and high-quality content for our brand, including articles, videos, blog posts, social media updates, and other digital media.
	As a content creator, you will play a pivotal role in crafting content that resonates with our target audience, promotes brand awareness, and supports our marketing strategies.


Key Responsibilities


	Content Creation: Develop original, engaging, and informative content for various platforms, including websites, blogs, social media, and marketing materials.
	Content Strategy: Collaborate with the marketing team to develop and execute content strategies aligned with the company’s goals and audience preferences.
	Audience Engagement: Interact with followers and audiences across platforms, responding to comments and messages, and fostering community engagement.
	Content Editing: Edit and proofread content to ensure accuracy, clarity, and consistency in style and tone.
	Analytics and Reporting: Track the performance of content, analyze audience engagement metrics, and adjust strategies based on insights.
	Collaborative Work: Work with designers, marketers, and other team members to create cohesive and visually appealing content.
	Research industry-related topics and identify content for promotional use.
	Conduct keyword research and use SEO to improve web traffic.
	Stay updated on content trends, software, and best practices.


Skills and Qualifications


	Proven experience as a content creator, copywriter, or similar role.
	Strong writing, editing, and proofreading skills with an eye for detail.
	Experience in content creation for different platforms (blogs, social media, websites, videos).
	Proficiency in video editing software (e.g., Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro) and graphic design tools (e.g., Canva, Adobe Creative Suite).
	Knowledge of SEO best practices and web traffic metrics.
	Ability to work independently and meet deadlines while managing multiple projects.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Creativity, adaptability, and a passion for staying up-to-date with digital trends.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr2@tildenng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Civil Engineer Job at Crescent Rice Mill Limited
content:
Crescent Rice Mill Limited is a leading rice processing company located at KM 15, Kano - Gumel Road, Jogana, Kano, Nigeria. With a vision to provide high-quality rice products to homes and businesses across Nigeria, we leverage advanced milling technology and a dedicated workforce to meet our customers' demands. We specialize in producing a variety of rice products, including Head Rice, Broken Rice, Reject Rice, Khus-Khus Rice, and Rice Bran. Our operations are strategically located in Kano, Nigeria’s commercial hub, enabling us to maintain efficient distribution channels across the nation.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Founded with a commitment to excellence and sustainability, Crescent Rice Mill Limited collaborates with local farmers to source premium rice paddy, ensuring that our processes support the agricultural community and promote economic development.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Civil Engineer

Job Location: Kano
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Civil Engineer will be responsible for supervising and maintaining the structural integrity, layout, and civil works within our rice milling facility.
	This includes overseeing factory construction, site development, repair works, drainage systems, utility structures, and collaborating with the maintenance and operations teams to ensure safety and efficiency of the infrastructure.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee all civil engineering projects within the factory premises including buildings, foundations, drainage, concrete floors, and factory layouts.
	Provide technical advice on structural load, stress points, and durability of factory buildings and silos.
	Prepare and review engineering drawings, and site progress reports.
	Ensure that all factory structures comply with regulatory and safety standards.
	Monitor civil works to ensure proper use of materials, adherence to specifications, and cost efficiency.
	Collaborate with facility maintenance, mechanical, and utility teams to support cross-functional factory operations.
	Supervise and maintain all structural and civil components of the rice mill facility, including production buildings, paddy yards, silos, drying floors, drainage, and internal roads.
	Maintain accurate documentation of all site inspections, work completed, and repairs conducted.
	Manage documentation for regulatory compliance and ensure factory structures meet SON, and factory safety requirements.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor's / Master's Degree with 5 - 8 years of experience.


Salary
N200,000 - N300,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr.crescentricemill@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Executive Assistant Job at West Africa Vocational Education (WAVE)
content:
West Africa Vocational Education is solving what is arguably the biggest challenge on the continent: youth unemployment. In West Africa, 40-85% of youth, more than 50 million, are either unemployed or underemployed. Meanwhile, job creation in the region is on the rise. The disconnect between work-ready youth and the employment market must be bridged.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Assistant

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time

Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Manage calendars, schedule meetings, and organize appointments for senior executives
	Coordinate travel arrangements, including booking flights, accommodations, and transportation
	Draft, proofread, and manage professional correspondence, reports, and presentations
	Maintain and organize files, records, and confidential documents
	Serve as a liaison between executives, staff, and external stakeholders
	Take meeting minutes and follow up on action items and deadlines
	Assist in planning and coordinating internal and external events
	Perform general office management tasks such as ordering supplies and managing vendors
	Support ad-hoc administrative projects and tasks as assigned.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Office Management, or a related field preferred
	1–2 years of experience as an Executive Assistant, Administrative Assistant, or similar role
	Strong written and verbal communication skills
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and Google Workspace tools
	Excellent time management and organizational skills
	High level of discretion and confidentiality
	Ability to multitask and work under pressure in a fast-paced environment
	Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills.


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitments@waveacademies.org using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
